dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAPTION: 26th January 2002 A Sheraton car pulls up and STEVE LeVINE, a discreet and serious looking man, gets out. His driver brings boxes of office supplies from the car. There are various phone company workers in the street and an argument going on wi one of the neighbours in the background. CAPTION : STEVE LeVINE, CENTRAL ASIA CORRESPONDENT, WALL

dialogues.speaker: STREET JOURNAL
dialogues.text: He shows his US passport and is let through by the GUARDS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HASAN is busy setting up and plugging in speaker phones. The information has to be shared by all. TWO PAKISTANI COMPUTER EXPERTS work on computers. STEVE LEVINE enters and sees MARIANE. STEVE hugs her.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I got here as soon as I could. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: I‘m Ok.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: No news?

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: No.  Pink Revision - 27th Sept 2006 55A ASRA comes down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: You two must know each other. Working for the same paper?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: We've never met. I’m Steve LeVine.

dialogues.speaker: ASRA
dialogues.text: Asra Nomani.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I brought some office supplies.

dialogues.speaker: ASRA
dialogues.text: Great. ASRA notices a PAKISTANI PHONE COMPANY MAN is putting in extra phone lines. They speak in Urdu.

dialogues.speaker: ASRA
dialogues.text: (to the Phone Man) How many lines are you hooking up?

dialogues.speaker: PHONE WORKER
dialogues.text: Six. We're getting the lines from your neighbours.

dialogues.speaker: ASRA
dialogues.text: What about their phones?  Pink Revision - 27th Sept 2006 56

dialogues.speaker: PHONE WORKER
dialogues.text: Cut off.

dialogues.speaker: ASRA
dialogues.text: Oh my God, we're going to need extra police just to keep us safe from the neighbours. (To Steve) Would you like some tea?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: That'd be great. ASRA goes off to ask SHABIR to make some tea. STEVE tries to gauge MARIANE’s state of mind. He’s immediately impressed by her focus.

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: How was the honeymoon?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Good. MARIANE introduces STEVE to HASAN. The TWO MEN shake hand The two immediately like each other.

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: Steve and Danny worked together in Islamabad.

dialogues.speaker: INT _- MARRIOTT HOTEL RECEPTION ISLAMABAD
dialogues.text: The reception is crowded with JOURNALISTS and CAMERA CREW STEVE and DANNY are eating breakfast. MARIANE is talking other JOURNALISTS by the reception. She sees a famous US correspondent crossing to the exit and dashes after her.

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: Hi, I’m from French radio and I’m doing an article about the way the Western media is covering the war in Afghanistan.

dialogues.speaker: US CORRESPONDENT
dialogues.text: Yeah? Well I’m part of the Western media and I’m covering the war in Afghanistan. The journalist walks off leaving MARIANE a little crestfallen. She glances across to DANNY and STEVE. DANNY laughs.

dialogues.speaker: PICK UP ON
dialogues.text: = ’ = 106 The Chart. It’s gradually becoming more and more detailed As we hear STEVE we see the names he mentions:

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: So they still need to find Arif the go- between... Bashir in Rawalpindi, Imtiaz Siddique here in Karachi and Gilani wherever he is.

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: And Danny.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: And Danny. STEVE looks at MARIANE.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Do you think it’s connected to the story he was working on?  Pink Revision - 27th Sept 2006 58

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: We don’t know. You saw this? MARIANE hands STEVE the story from the Boston Globe which made the link between Richard Reid and Gilani. We see glimpses of the text as the conversation continues.

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: But it could be something else. Every story here leads back to jihadis.

dialogues.speaker: ASRA
dialogues.text: Or the intelligence services. Or both.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I can go through all the stories we worked on together. See if anything connects.

dialogues.speaker: ASRA
dialogues.text: I‘ll help you. PICK UP on the office later. STEVE and ASRA are working away on their computers checki through DANNY‘s old stories and going on the internet to get more information. ZAFIR and HASAN are working on the mails sent by BASHIR. The CAPTAIN arrives with DOST.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Sheikh Mubarak Ali Shah Gilani. DOST hands a photograph over to ASRA. She sticks it onto The Chart.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: We sent officers to his house in Lahore. No one’s there. None of his wives. MARIANE looks at the photo of GILANI.

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: How many has he?

dialogues.speaker: DOST
dialogues.text: Three. The latest is a 23 year old Canadian. ASRA writes this on the chart.  59.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: The only person they managed to find is his sister-in-law. She says he isn’t capable of organizing a kidnapping.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Who needs enemies with relatives like that?

dialogues.speaker: PICK UP ON
dialogues.text: On a computer screen, an article from the Independent. January 24th.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Hasan - can you print this out?

dialogues.speaker: ASRA
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: It’s from the London bureau. About a British Pakistani - Omar Saeed Sheikh. HASAN brings a printed copy of the article over to ASRA.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: It claims he wired $100,000 to Mohammed Atta just before 9/11.

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: How does this connect with Danny? ASRA is reading the article on Steve’s computer.

dialogues.speaker: ASRA
dialogues.text: He’s based in Rawalpindi and he specialises in kidnapping Westerners. MARIANE and ASRA look at CAPTAIN.

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: Do you know him?

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Only by reputation. MARIANE starts to read the article when the phone rings. ASRA answers it. KHAWAJA is shouting at her down the line

dialogues.speaker: ASRA
dialogues.text: (Speaking in Urdu) Don’t talk to me like that. It’s nothing to do with us.  60. CAPTAIN motions for ASRA to hand over the phone to him. H walks off with the receiver talking in a low controlled voice.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: (Speaking in Urdu) This is the SSP CID He listens to KHAWAJA as he walks away with the phone.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Who was that?

dialogues.speaker: ASRA
dialogues.text: Khalid Khawaja. He’s a friend of Gilani’s. He keeps on calling. Gilani’s father died last week and now he’s screaming at me claiming he died from shame - because of the Boston Globe article connecting his son to the terrorists.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: The power of the press. CAPTAIN comes back with the phone.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Mr. Khawaja won’t be phoning you again.

dialogues.speaker: MARTANE,
dialogues.text: Thank you. PICK UP ON RANDALL BENNETT coming into the house, full of energy. CAPTION: 13.15 26th January 2002

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: Okay girls, I’m taking you to McDonald’s.

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: No. I can’t... I’d rather stay here.

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: You need some air. Come on. Think of your son.

dialogues.speaker: ASRA
dialogues.text: What about the phones?

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: Don’t you trust Hasan and Dost?  107 107pt 108 109 61. MARIANE looks at RANDALL. INT/EXT - RANDALL’S 4X4/ KARACHI STREETS - DAY 107 RANDALL's Black Chevy drives through the Karachi traffic. They go past the Two Swords roundabout where SHABIR got t taxis. MARIANE sits in the car, her mind drifting. Her life suspended. She looks round and sees Danny sitting with her in a taxi driving through the 107p streets of Paris They arrive at the Park Tower Shopping Mall. INT_- SHOPPING MALL — DAY 108 A shopping mall. Shiny clean and uniform. Western lifesty in a laboratory. RANDALL leads ZAFIR, Asra and Mariane pa the clothes shops to McDonalds. As they walk in RANDALL bumps into TWO YOUNG AUSTRALIAN TOURISTS.

dialogues.speaker: AUSTRALIAN GIRL
dialogues.text: Oh sorry.

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: No problem. Do it again anytime. The GIRL laughs. ASRA, MARIANE and ZAFIR go through.

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: Where are you girls from?

dialogues.speaker: AUSTRALIAN GIRL
dialogues.text: Sydney... Australia. And you?

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: (smiles) Me. Oh I’m from here.

dialogues.speaker: INT__A_MCDONALD'S RESTAURANT
dialogues.text: It's filled with PAKISTANIS enjoying their Meal Deals. AS is wolfing her meal down.

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: How long have you been in Karachi?  110 111 62.

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: Five years. You’re only supposed to be here for a year because it’s a high risk posting. But I love it here. MARIANE picks at her salad.

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: The people. Like Zafir. He’s my brother. ZAFIR smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ZAFIR
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: ASRA
dialogues.text: Should we be worried about the I.S.I. bugging the house?

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: You can trust Dost and the Captain. But you can never be sure with the other guys. MARIANE has another go at her salad but gives up. = ‘ = 110 RANDALL’s black chevy drops ASRA and MARIANE back at the house. CAPTION : 15.30 26th JANUARY 2006 = ‘ = 111 The CAPTAIN, DOST, KALEEM YUSUF, HASAN and everyone are there. STEVE hands over a printed out e-mail to MARIANE a soon as she and ASRA enter the room.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: There’s been another e-mail from Bashir. The Journal sent it over from Washington. As we see the text of the e-mail beginning - Dear Mr. Pea how did the meeting with the Shaikh go? - we hear ASRA’s immediate reaction.  112 113 63.

dialogues.speaker: ASRA
dialogues.text: The fucker. He knows Danny’s missing. I e-mailed him the first night. DOsT He’s trying to look innocent. As though he knows nothing.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: (to Mariane) You should do the same. Answer as though you suspect nothing. PICK UP on MARIANE as she writes her e-mail to BASHIR. He features are tense. She hates this man. On the screen, we see fragments : I am Danny Pearl’s wife...I am very concerned...I appreciate your concern... thank you so much.. The phone rings. ASRA answers.

dialogues.speaker: ASRA
dialogues.text: Hello. Oh hello John. Yeah we saw it. Yes. Here she is. She passes it to MARIANE.

dialogues.speaker: ASRA
dialogues.text: It’s Bussey. He wants to talk to you, MARIANE paces around the room on the phone to BUSSEY.

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: Yes I’m ok. We need you here.

dialogues.speaker: INT_- WALL STREET JOURNAL NEW JERSEY
dialogues.text: BUSSEY is on the phone in his office.

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE V.O
dialogues.text: Come to Karachi. Make the diplomatic rounds with us. We need to put pressure on the authorities.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: OK. That’s what I thought too. - ’ = 113 CAPTAIN looks at MARIANE. She looks drained from lack of sleep. She puts the phone down.  64.

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: Can I talk to you?

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: MARIANE and CAPTAIN sit, watching the parrots. CAPTAIN lights up a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: I need to tell you something. CAPTAIN looks up at MARIANE waiting for her to continue. MARIANE (CONT’D) Danny isn’t religious. But he is Jewish by birth. CAPTAIN takes a moment, registering the importance of thi fact. He knows how deep the hate runs.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Who else knows this?

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: He didn't advertise it, but he'd never deny it if someone asked. They sit there in silence.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: I am religious. I go to the mosque for Friday prayers. I have faith. But you know Islam teaches peace. Not hatred.

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: My faith has been kidnapped by the same people who have taken Danny.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: The FBI TEAM and ZAFIR work on the new e-mail. RANDALL BENNETT walks in.

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: Have you traced where it’s from?

dialogues.speaker: ZAFIR
dialogues.text: Not yet.  116 Pink Revision ~ 27th Sept 2006 65

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: The house is quiet but for the distant sound of the call prayer before sunset. EVERYONE has gone home to their families for dinner. MARIANE is on the phone to SATCHI, her brother. INTERCUT : SATCHI stands in his Paris flat. CAPTION: SATCHI VAN NEYENHOFF, MARIANE’S BROTHER

dialogues.speaker: SATCHI
dialogues.text: Le gens envoient leur soutien du monde entier. Ils appellent tous les jours. Il faudrait que le monde entier medite avec nous. (People from all over the world are sending their support. I am receiving calls every day. What we need is for the whole world to chant with us.)

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: Oui... imagine. (Yes... imagine.) As MARIANE listens to SATCHI, she starts going through so of DANNY’s stuff. She finds and tapes up on the wall the comical photo of a giraffe and her baby that DANNY likes much. It looks like the giraffes are winking.

dialogues.speaker: SATCHI
dialogues.text: Ca va? (How are you?)

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: Oui... Ca va. Le bebe bouge. (Yes... I’m okay. The baby’s moving.) MARIANE lies down on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: Il ne me donne pas de coups de pieds. Il veut just dire qu’il est la. (He doesn’t kick. He’s just saying he’s here.)

dialogues.speaker: SATCHI
dialogues.text: Ca va aller. Tout va bien se passer. (It’s going to be all right. You’re going to be fine.) Ht He KK RH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: se OR OF ee ed eH EK  117 118 Pink Revision - 27th Sept 2006 65A MARIANE picks up and starts flicking absently through her pregnancy book. “What to expect when you are expecting”.

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT
dialogues.text: NOOR and MASUD sit in a car watching as FIFTEEN or TWENTY POLICE enter the Hotel Akbar. MASUD looks somber. INT - HOTEL AKBAR/RAWALPINDI ~— NIGHT 118 The HOTEL RECEPTIONIST and OTHER STAFF are being picked u by the POLICE for questioning.  119 120 121 122 123 124 125 66.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT
dialogues.text: NOOR looks at MASUD expectantly as the MEN are being brought out of the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: NOOR
dialogues.text: Recognise anyone?

dialogues.speaker: MASUD
dialogues.text: No. = f = 120 MARIANE lies in bed with her “what to do when expecting” book. Unable to sleep. Unable to read.

dialogues.speaker: INT_- _HOUSE/RAWALPINDI
dialogues.text: NOOR and TWENTY POLICEMEN IN PLAIN CLOTHES armed with AK4 automatics, storm through rooms, climbing up stairs, searching and examining furniture, rummaging through drawers. The house was the HQ of the Harkat- ul-Mujahideen in Rawalpindi. There are quite a FEW MEN, posters and piles videos.

dialogues.speaker: INT_- CONSULATE
dialogues.text: RANDALL is typing up a report of the days events includin the raids in Rawalpindi. = ‘ = 124 MARIANE lies in bed awake. She keeps her hands on her swollen belly and chants to herself. = ’ =. 125 DOST walks into the house, looking stressed, carrying copies of the newspaper Jang. CAPTION: 09.00 27th January 2002  126 67.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: A newspaper - Jang ~ lies on the table with a picture of DANNY on the front page, smiling out at us. The same photograph MARIANE gave to the police the first morning after DANNY's kidnapping. DOST and CAPTAIN look at MARIANE. MARIANE, expressionless, waits for them to talk. A tense silence.

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: What does it say? DOsT It says that Danny is suspected of being a Mossad agent and of having relations with India’s intelligence agency. MARIANE looks like she’s just been kicked in the stomach.

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: What? She stares at the photo of DANNY smiling at her. Her voic cracks with anger.

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: I gave them that photo! The police asked me for a photo of Danny. Who was that guy I gave the photo to?!!

dialogues.speaker: DOST
dialogues.text: Military intelligence. MARIANE paces like a wounded animal, drowning in her own powerlessness.

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: '‘Mossad,' for fuck's sake! They'11 kill him if they think he's Mossad! What are we going to do? What are you people doing? She picks up the phone and dials a number she gets from T Chart.

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: I want to speak to Minister Haider. Mariane Pearl....Mariane Pearl... MARIANE is almost shouting  127 68.

dialogues.speaker: MARTANE
dialogues.text: Mariane Pearl..the wife of the kidnapped journalist. She sees CAPTAIN watching her. He’s upset and angry but hides it.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Let me deal with it. You are right but let me deal with it. DANNY smiles out of the paper at MARIANE. INT_- ASRA’S HOUSE - DAY/LATER 127 ASRA and LeVINE are glued to their computers. The tension is palpable. Everyone is demoralized after the morning’s Jang headline. They’re all hot, exhausted and on edge. The phone rings. ASRA picks up. She listens, digesting wh is being said at the other end and rushes to her computer

dialogues.speaker: ASRA
dialogues.text: There’s an e-mail. It’s from the kidnappers. EVERYONE stops in their tracks.

dialogues.speaker: ASRA
dialogues.text: The Journal’s forwarding it to us. EVERYONE gathers around the computer to look at the e-mai from kidnapperguy@hotmail.com

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: There’s an attachment. ASRA clicks on the attachment. The first photo opens : DANNY, in front of a blue screen, wearing a shiny hot pink and baby blue jogging suit. His wrists are in chains and his glasses have gone. A MAN ina white salwar kameez grips the back of his head shoving it forward and with his other hand, levels a revolver an inc from his head.

dialogues.speaker: DOST
dialogues.text: They do it to shock you. MARIANE looks at the photos without flinching, torn by conflicting emotions but shocked back into defiance when she notices DANNY’s smile on the third photo.

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: He’s smiling.  69. As we see the photos ASRA reads out the e-mail.

dialogues.speaker: ASRA
dialogues.text: The national movement for the restoration of Pakistani sovereignty has captured CIA officer Daniel Pearl who has been posing as a journalist of the Wall Street Journal. MARIANE is focusing on DANNY’s face, on his smile.

dialogues.speaker: ASRA
dialogues.text: Unfortunately he is at present being kept in very inhuman conditions quite similar in fact to the way that Pakistanis ...are being kept in Cuba by the American army...if America wants the release of Mr. Pearl all .-Pakistani prisoners in Cuba must be returned to Pakistan...

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: Who the fuck are they?

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Some group they made up for this. (to Dost) Call Randall Bennett.

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: There's more in Urdu. CAPTAIN leans in with his cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: What does it say?

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: They are asking for the release of fighter jets that Pakistan bought from the US in the eighties.

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: This is crazy. It makes no fucking sense. Print outs of DANNY’s photos are being spewed out of the laser printer.

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: What are they up to? They don't want to negotiate with us.  128 70. ASRA spreads the photos on the table. A piece of paper has been taped to a phone : "DO NOT TOUC

dialogues.speaker: INCOMING CALLS ONLY -FOR DANNY"
dialogues.text: A new answering machine is being attached to it. CAPTAIN instructing ASRA and MARIANE.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Nobody touches this line. This is the number Danny knows. This is the number he will use to contact you. CAPTAIN and DOST are busy making hundreds of calls. = t = 128 CAPTION: 11.00 27th January 2002 RANDALL, ZAFIR, MAUREEN PLATT, JOHN and TWO OTHER FBI AGENTS stride into the house.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: They’ve made contact. The FBI AGENTS immediately start their work to source the computer who sent the e-mail.

dialogues.speaker: ZAFIR
dialogues.text: We need the original e-mail so we can see the header. That might give us an IP address.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: It was originally sent to the Washington Post.

dialogues.speaker: OK
dialogues.text: RANDALL and MAUREEN PLATT study the photos for authentici around the table.

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: That’s a doctored photo. Check out the angle of the shoulder. That doesn’t look right with the head. The legs are too big. That’s not Danny.

dialogues.speaker: ASRA
dialogues.text: I don’t think it’s Danny either.  71.

dialogues.speaker: MAUREEN PLATT
dialogues.text: Let’s send them to the lab in Honolulu.

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: Maureen, look at the gun. EVERYONE has a theory. Only MARIANE is silent. CAPTAIN is looking at her.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Mariane? What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: It's him. It's Danny. EVERYONE becomes silent.

dialogues.speaker: MAUREEN PLATT
dialogues.text: We should still send it off to Honolulu. The phone rings. MARIANE goes and picks it up. 129 = f = 129 RUTH is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: Have you seen them? The photos of Danny?

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: Yes. You’ve got them too?

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: They just came.

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: People here weren’t sure they were Danny.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: Of course they are. I recognise his hands. We see the photograph of DANNY, and RUTH looking fondly a her son’s hands. 130 = t = = 130

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: I know. I recognise his wedding ring. It's loose on his finger. It's always been loose.  Blue Revision - 11th Oct 2006 72

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: It’s good news. MARIANE is blank.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: It means Danny is alive. MARIANE’s features tense up. The stabbing pain of a contraction runs through her body. She holds her breath.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH, (V.0O)
dialogues.text: Mariane? The pain goes away.

dialogues.speaker: JUDEA
dialogues.text: Its important no one finds out we are from Israel. We are trying to get everything removed from the internet that might connect Danny to us.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: They're going to release him. Nobody would ever want to hurt Danny. We see.for a moment Danny sitting in an anonymous room, i the clothes he wears in the photograph. MARIANE puts the phone down. CAPTAIN comes over to her. They look at the photographs together.

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: Look. Danny is smiling. With a gun to his head he’s smiling. He's telling me he is OK. A half-smile spreads unexpectedly on MARIANE’s face as sh notices DANNY’s fingers forming a 'V’.

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: (smiling as if smiling back at Danny) He's giving them the finger. A sense of pride at DANNY’s defiance.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: I‘m sorry, but it is time to see Interior Minister Haider. ee ee

dialogues.text: ee OF  Blue Revision - 1lth Oct 2006 72a

dialogues.text: I‘ll take you. MARIANE doesn’t want to go now - but she knows she has to  131 132 133 73. = ’ = 131 In their Sunday best, a DELEGATION of plain clothes SENIO OFFICERS come and go in and out of the house and get into caravan of cars. A distinguished man with white hair, shakes hands with MARIANE.

dialogues.speaker: EXT_- CONVOY/ KARACHI STREETS
dialogues.text: A convoy, official cars and at the end of the caravan, th warn-out jeeps with CAPTAIN and DOST - driving through Karachi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIANE sits with BAUMAN. She is tense. She stares out of the window, seeing the crowds of people, the mosques, the offices, the houses. We see Danny in the back of a taxi being driven through Karachi The convoy snakes its way through the thick traffic, braving the chaos and cacophony of the over-crowded, congested streets.

dialogues.speaker: BAUMAN
dialogues.text: We need the Minister to authorise a national force to look for Danny. Just because he was taken here in Karachi doesn’t mean he is still here.

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: Right. Asra has arranged for Paul Steiger of the Journal to call us whilst we are there. To try and impress the minister..

dialogues.speaker: BAUMAN
dialogues.text: Good. We should get a good hearing. Haider’s brother was assassinated only a month ago.

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: Really? How?

dialogues.speaker: BAUMAN
dialogues.text: Shot driving home from work. MARIANE stares out at the cars and PEOPLE.  134 74. = ’ = 134 MARIANE and the whole ENTOURAGE are led into the MINISTER office. MARIANE shakes hands with MINISTER HAIDER who is traditional mourning dress.

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: Thank you for meeting us. I know you have your own problems.

dialogues.speaker: HAIDER
dialogues.text: Please, sit down. PICK UP later. The meeting has already been going on for while and everyone is getting tense.

dialogues.speaker: MINISTER HAIDER

dialogues.text: Our information is that the Indian intelligence services are behind the kidnapping.

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: Well, first of all I would tell them that my feelings and my affection for this country have not changed because of what happened here ..on the contrary, people .. the people.. have shown tremendous support for me they have shared my sorrow. I know they feel bad, ashamed... sad... about what happened... also the people who have actually been around me during this ordeal... this terrible time... have been... people of heart, of tremendous professionalism. with very very limited resources. PICK UP on a meal that IBARHIM has cooked. MARIANE begins to make a speech.

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: I want to say something to you... I know how hard you have worked. I know it has been hard for you. I just want to thank you. I don’t want any of you to feel guilty. I don’t want any of you to feel you have failed. Danny is dead. But that doesn’t mean the kidnappers have won. We must be happy. We have to refuse guilt and despair and fear. That is what they want us to have. We have to refuse bitterness. That is what Danny would have wanted. MARIANE looks particularly at CAPTAIN. She hugs them one one. dialogues.speaker: MARIANE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They found Danny’s body cut into ten pieces. Nobody told me this. I learned it in an e-mail that was attached by accident to another e-mail sent to me. INT - MARIANE’S FLAT —- PARIS - DAY 276 MARIANE lying on the bed, very calm. The phone is off the hook.

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I decided that before Adam is born I have to confront everything that happened to Danny. He was held in an isolated shack in a compound on the outskirts of Karachi. One day, when he was unshackled to go to the toilet, he tried to escape. They caught him and chained him to the engine of a car. Another time he tried to break loose when he was walking with his captors. Once he shouted to a passerby. Then one day - probably February lst - three Arabs were brought to the compound. Danny argued with one of them. Then they turned on the video and asked him questions about his religion.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: My father is Jewish, my mother is Jewish, I am Jewish. = ‘ = = 277 MARIANE still lying on the bed. Still imagining DANNY.

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE
dialogues.text: Maybe they made him say this. But I know he was undefeated because of the next thing he says, something the kidnappers could not have known, something he says for me, for his parents and for Adam.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: In the town of Benei Berag in Israel there’s a street called Chaim Pearl Street, which is named after my great-grandfather, who was one of the founders of the town. = f = = 278 MARIANE is still there in bed, tears on her face.

dialogues.speaker: MARIANE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I force myself to imagine it all and when it is over I know there is nothing that can happen that I won’t have the courage to face.
